name: Oregano (Dried)
properties: Featured in multiple soup and vegetable recipes
Can be used as alternative to herbes de Provence
benefits: Oregano is one of the most antioxidant-rich herbs available. It contains compounds with anti-inflammatory properties and adds robust flavor to bean soups, vegetable dishes, and Mediterranean recipes. Used in traditional dishes like Caldo Verde and various bean soups throughout the cookbook.
amount: 1/2 to 1 teaspoon dried per recipe, or as part of daily herb and spice servings

quotes: ½ teaspoon dried oregano - Red Bean and Butternut Caldo Verde (page 41)
1 teaspoon herbes de Provence, or ½ teaspoon dried oregano and ½ teaspoon dried basil - Ratatouille-Inspired Puy Lentil Soup (page 62)
½ teaspoon dried oregano - Southwest Kale Salad with Cumin-Tomato Dressing (page 94)
